pillars.title: Education & Academics
subGoals: Earn a Bachelor's degree in STEM field (e.g., Engineering, Physics, Biology)
Maintain a GPA of 3.5 or higher
Complete advanced coursework in relevant subjects (e.g., calculus, orbital mechanics)
Pursue a Master's or Doctoral degree in a specialized area
Achieve high scores on standardized tests (e.g., GRE, medical exams if applicable)
Publish research papers in academic journals
Attend relevant academic conferences and workshops
Secure strong letters of recommendation from professors

pillars.title: Physical & Mental Fitness
subGoals: Maintain excellent cardiovascular health (e.g., regular running, swimming)
Engage in strength training to build physical resilience
Develop good nutrition habits and maintain a healthy weight
Practice mindfulness and stress management techniques
Undergo regular medical check-ups and maintain peak physical condition
Participate in activities that test endurance and mental fortitude (e.g., hiking, marathons)
Develop strong sleep hygiene and recovery routines
Learn and practice survival skills relevant to remote environments

pillars.title: Technical Skills & Experience
subGoals: Gain hands-on experience in relevant technical fields (e.g., coding, robotics)
Acquire piloting experience (e.g., private pilot license)
Develop proficiency in operating complex machinery and equipment
Learn about spacecraft systems and operations
Engage in engineering projects or design challenges
Seek internships or co-op positions in aerospace or related industries
Become certified in relevant technical skills (e.g., SCUBA diving for EVA simulation)
Develop problem-solving skills under pressure

pillars.title: Teamwork & Leadership
subGoals: Participate in team-based projects and demonstrate effective collaboration
Develop strong communication skills, both verbal and written
Take on leadership roles in academic or extracurricular activities
Learn to resolve conflicts constructively within a team
Practice active listening and empathy
Gain experience working with diverse groups of people
Understand and adapt to different leadership styles
Volunteer for roles that require responsibility and dependability

pillars.title: Space Exploration Knowledge
subGoals: Study the history and current state of space exploration
Learn about different space agencies and their missions
Understand the challenges and rewards of human spaceflight
Follow developments in new space technologies and research
Read biographies of famous astronauts and scientists
Learn about orbital mechanics and astrodynamics
Understand space weather and its impact on missions
Develop a deep appreciation for the scientific and exploratory aspects of space

pillars.title: Adaptability & Resilience
subGoals: Seek out challenging experiences that push comfort zones
Develop coping mechanisms for isolation and confinement
Learn to thrive in high-stress environments
Practice problem-solving in unpredictable situations
Embrace continuous learning and adaptation
Develop patience and perseverance through setbacks
Cultivate a positive outlook and mental toughness
Gain experience in unfamiliar and demanding environments

pillars.title: Application & Selection Process
subGoals: Thoroughly research astronaut selection criteria for target agencies
Prepare a compelling resume and application
Practice interview questions and behavioral assessments
Undergo psychological evaluations and team exercises
Successfully pass all medical and physical fitness tests
Demonstrate suitability for long-duration space missions
Network with individuals in the aerospace industry
Be prepared for multiple application cycles and learn from each attempt

pillars.title: Continuous Improvement & Learning
subGoals: Stay updated on the latest advancements in space technology
Seek mentorship from experienced professionals
Continuously assess and improve skills identified in the selection process
Learn new languages relevant to international space collaboration
Engage in lifelong learning across diverse disciplines
Seek feedback and act upon constructive criticism
Maintain a strong network within the aerospace community
Develop a personal growth plan for ongoing development

commits.text: Read 20 pages of orbital mechanics textbook

classification.summary: Reading about orbital mechanics directly contributes to the Education & Academics pillar by building foundational knowledge. It also supports Space Exploration Knowledge by providing context for how spacecraft operate and Adaptability & Resilience by helping to understand complex systems, which is crucial for problem-solving in space. Furthermore, it fosters Continuous Improvement & Learning by expanding one's understanding of essential concepts.

commits.text: Read 20 pages of orbital mechanics textbook

classification.summary: Reading an orbital mechanics textbook directly contributes to foundational knowledge in Education & Academics. It also builds essential Space Exploration Knowledge, as orbital mechanics is fundamental to spaceflight. Furthermore, it supports Adaptability & Resilience by developing problem-solving skills and a deeper understanding of complex systems, and Continuous Improvement & Learning by expanding knowledge base.

commits.text: Read 20 pages of orbital mechanics textbook

classification.summary: Reading an orbital mechanics textbook directly contributes to building a strong foundation in Education & Academics and deepens Space Exploration Knowledge. It also supports Continuous Improvement & Learning by acquiring new, specialized information.

commits.text: Wrote a blog post about space exploration

classification.summary: Writing a blog post about space exploration contributes to Education & Academics by solidifying knowledge and communicating it. It significantly enhances Space Exploration Knowledge by requiring research and synthesis of information. It also touches on Continuous Improvement & Learning by developing communication skills and potentially receiving feedback.

Meditation significantly contributes to Physical & Mental Fitness by reducing stress, improving focus, and enhancing emotional regulation, all crucial for the demanding astronaut lifestyle. It also indirectly supports the Application & Selection Process by fostering a calm and centered mindset.

Networking can lead to learning about educational paths and requirements (Education & Academics), understanding opportunities to gain experience and technical skills (Technical Skills & Experience), building connections with potential mentors or colleagues to develop teamwork and leadership abilities (Teamwork & Leadership), and potentially discovering insights into the selection process and requirements (Application & Selection Process).

Studying physics is fundamental for understanding the principles of spaceflight, orbital mechanics, and the physics of the universe, directly impacting Education & Academics and Space Exploration Knowledge. It also develops critical thinking and problem-solving skills that contribute to Adaptability & Resilience and Continuous Improvement.

Meditation significantly contributes to Physical & Mental Fitness by reducing stress and improving focus. It also aids in Adaptability & Resilience by training the mind to handle challenging situations calmly. Furthermore, it supports Continuous Improvement & Learning by enhancing self-awareness and mental clarity.

Meditation significantly contributes to Physical & Mental Fitness by reducing stress and improving focus, which are crucial for astronaut training and demanding environments. It also indirectly supports the Application & Selection Process by enhancing mental clarity and composure during interviews and assessments.

Running 5km significantly contributes to Physical & Mental Fitness by improving cardiovascular health and endurance. It also indirectly supports the Application & Selection Process by demonstrating discipline and a commitment to a healthy lifestyle, which are often evaluated during astronaut selection.

pillars.title: Music Theory & Ear Training
subGoals: Master fundamental music theory concepts (scales, chords, harmony)
Develop a strong understanding of rhythm and groove
Practice active listening to identify song structure and instrumentation
Learn to recognize and differentiate common electronic music genres
Train ear to identify melodies and basslines by ear
Understand basic synthesis principles (oscillators, filters, envelopes)
Learn to identify and analyze common chord progressions
Develop critical listening skills to analyze my own and others' music

pillars.title: Digital Audio Workstation (DAW) Proficiency
subGoals: Become proficient in a chosen DAW (e.g., Ableton Live, FL Studio, Logic Pro)
Master basic DAW functions (recording, editing, mixing, arrangement)
Learn advanced DAW features and workflows
Understand and utilize automation extensively
Efficiently use MIDI editing and quantization tools
Explore and master audio effect plugins
Develop efficient project management within the DAW
Learn to navigate and customize the DAW interface for optimal workflow

pillars.title: Sound Design & Synthesis
subGoals: Understand the fundamentals of subtractive, additive, and FM synthesis
Learn to create compelling basslines and lead sounds from scratch
Master sound manipulation techniques (sampling, granular synthesis)
Develop a signature sound palette
Experiment with hardware and software synthesizers
Learn to use synthesizers to create atmospheric pads and textures
Understand the role of envelopes and LFOs in sound shaping
Explore creative ways to process and layer sounds

pillars.title: Arrangement & Songwriting
subGoals: Learn to structure electronic music tracks effectively (intro, verse, chorus, breakdown, outro)
Develop strong melodic and harmonic ideas
Master dynamic contrast and tension building
Learn to create impactful transitions between song sections
Experiment with different arrangement techniques
Develop a systematic approach to finishing tracks
Understand the importance of repetition and variation in electronic music
Practice writing multiple song structures for different purposes

pillars.title: Mixing & Mastering Fundamentals
subGoals: Understand the principles of gain staging and signal flow
Learn to use EQ effectively to sculpt individual sounds
Master compression for dynamic control and punch
Understand and apply reverb and delay for space and depth
Learn basic stereo imaging techniques
Understand the principles of mastering for loudness and polish
Develop critical listening skills for mixing and mastering
Reference professional tracks to guide my own mixing decisions

pillars.title: Creative Workflow & Inspiration
subGoals: Establish a consistent creative routine
Actively seek inspiration from diverse sources
Develop a system for organizing sound libraries and samples
Embrace experimentation and happy accidents
Learn to overcome creative blocks
Collaborate with other musicians (even informally)
Set creative challenges for myself
Dedicate time for pure exploration and joy in making music

pillars.title: Learning & Skill Development
subGoals: Dedicate at least X hours per week to learning and practice
Complete online courses or tutorials on specific production techniques
Read books and articles about electronic music production
Analyze the production techniques of favorite artists
Attend workshops or masterclasses when opportunities arise
Learn about music theory relevant to electronic music genres
Stay updated with new music production technologies and trends
Continuously seek feedback and apply it to improve

pillars.title: Releasing & Sharing Music
subGoals: Finish and polish at least X tracks to a release-ready standard
Understand the basics of digital music distribution (DistroKid, TuneCore, etc.)
Learn how to create promotional materials (artwork, descriptions)
Develop a strategy for releasing music (single, EP, album)
Explore platforms for sharing music (SoundCloud, Bandcamp)
Engage with online music communities
Learn basic marketing and promotion strategies
Build a small but engaged audience for my music

commits.text: Maintained a strict sleep schedule for a week

classification.summary: A strict sleep schedule significantly boosts cognitive functions, enhancing focus, memory, and learning capacity, which are crucial for skill development in all areas of music production. Better rest improves creativity and problem-solving needed for sound design, arrangement, and mixing. It also supports consistent practice and dedication, essential for mastering a DAW and ear training. While it has less direct impact on releasing music, it lays a foundational mental state for sustained effort.

Studying physics can indirectly benefit music production by enhancing understanding of acoustics and wave principles (Music Theory & Ear Training, Sound Design & Synthesis). It also fosters analytical thinking and problem-solving skills, which are crucial for technical aspects and continuous learning (Learning & Skill Development).

Meditation can improve focus and concentration, which are essential for detailed tasks like ear training and sound design. It also fosters a calm mental state conducive to creative thinking and inspiration, and enhances the ability to learn and absorb new information, supporting overall skill development.

pillars.title: Foundational Knowledge
subGoals: Master Python programming fundamentals
Understand core statistical concepts (probability, hypothesis testing)
Grasp linear algebra and calculus basics relevant to ML
Learn SQL for database querying
Familiarize with data structures and algorithms
Understand version control (Git/GitHub)
Study data types and data manipulation techniques
Complete an introductory data science course

pillars.title: Technical Skills Development
subGoals: Become proficient in Pandas for data manipulation
Master NumPy for numerical operations
Learn Matplotlib and Seaborn for data visualization
Understand and apply Scikit-learn for machine learning algorithms
Explore deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow/PyTorch)
Gain experience with data cleaning and preprocessing techniques
Practice feature engineering and selection
Build and deploy a simple machine learning model

pillars.title: Domain Expertise
subGoals: Identify 2-3 target industries or domains
Study common data science applications within chosen domains
Learn domain-specific terminology and metrics
Analyze case studies from relevant industries
Seek mentorship from professionals in target domains
Understand ethical considerations in data science for specific fields
Participate in domain-specific data challenges
Develop a portfolio project related to a chosen domain

pillars.title: Portfolio Building
subGoals: Complete 3-5 diverse data science projects
Document each project thoroughly (problem, data, methodology, results)
Create a professional GitHub profile showcasing projects
Develop clear and concise project summaries
Practice explaining projects to non-technical audiences
Contribute to open-source data science projects
Create a personal website or blog to showcase work
Seek feedback on portfolio projects from peers and mentors

pillars.title: Continuous Learning & Staying Updated
subGoals: Follow leading data science blogs and publications
Subscribe to relevant newsletters
Attend webinars and online workshops
Read research papers on emerging topics
Join online communities and forums (e.g., Kaggle, Stack Overflow)
Experiment with new tools and libraries
Dedicate time weekly for learning new concepts
Set learning goals for the next 6 months

pillars.title: Networking & Community Engagement
subGoals: Attend local data science meetups
Connect with data scientists on LinkedIn
Participate actively in online forums and discussions
Seek informational interviews with experienced professionals
Offer help and insights to others in the community
Present a project or topic at a meetup
Build relationships with peers and potential mentors
Collaborate on a project with community members

pillars.title: Job Application & Interview Preparation
subGoals: Tailor resume and cover letters for data science roles
Practice common data science interview questions (technical and behavioral)
Prepare to discuss portfolio projects in detail
Study case studies for interview problem-solving
Understand typical company interview processes
Mock interviews with peers or mentors
Research target companies and their data science teams
Develop a strategy for the job search

pillars.title: Personal Growth & Mindset
subGoals: Cultivate curiosity and a passion for problem-solving
Develop resilience to overcome challenges and setbacks
Practice effective time management and discipline
Improve communication and storytelling skills
Learn to present complex information clearly
Seek constructive feedback and act on it
Maintain a healthy work-life balance
Celebrate small wins and track progress regularly

classification.summary: Meditation directly supports personal growth and mindset by improving focus, reducing stress, and enhancing mental clarity, which are all crucial for tackling the demanding learning and problem-solving inherent in becoming a data scientist.

Networking directly contributes to 'Job Application & Interview Preparation' and 'Networking & Community Engagement' by building connections and learning from others. It can also indirectly aid 'Domain Expertise' by exposing you to different industries and roles. 'Personal Growth & Mindset' is supported by developing communication and interpersonal skills.
Running 5km contributes to Personal Growth & Mindset by building discipline, resilience, and stress management, which are crucial for tackling the challenges of becoming a data scientist.

1763694855874.mainGoal: Tener mejor salud a mis 44 años

pillars.title: Nutrición Balanceada
subGoals: Consumir al menos 5 porciones de frutas y verduras al día.
Reducir el consumo de azúcares añadidos a menos de 25 gramos diarios.
Incorporar proteínas magras en cada comida principal.
Aumentar la ingesta de grasas saludables (aguacate, frutos secos, aceite de oliva).
Beber al menos 2 litros de agua al día.
Limitar el consumo de alimentos procesados y comida rápida a una vez por semana.
Preparar al menos 3 comidas caseras a la semana.
Explorar y probar una nueva verdura o fruta exótica cada mes.

pillars.title: Actividad Física Regular
subGoals: Realizar 150 minutos de ejercicio aeróbico moderado a la semana.
Incorporar 2 sesiones de entrenamiento de fuerza a la semana.
Caminar al menos 30 minutos al día.
Realizar estiramientos suaves durante 10 minutos diarios.
Probar una nueva actividad física al mes (ej: yoga, natación, senderismo).
Subir escaleras en lugar de usar el ascensor siempre que sea posible.
Despertarme 30 minutos antes para hacer ejercicio ligero.
Mantener un registro semanal de mi actividad física.

pillars.title: Sueño Reparador
subGoals: Dormir entre 7 y 8 horas por noche de forma consistente.
Establecer un horario fijo para acostarme y levantarme, incluso los fines de semana.
Crear una rutina relajante antes de dormir (leer, meditar, baño tibio).
Evitar pantallas (teléfono, tablet, TV) al menos una hora antes de dormir.
Asegurar que mi habitación esté oscura, silenciosa y a una temperatura agradable.
Limitar la cafeína y el alcohol, especialmente por la tarde.
Si me despierto en la noche, evitar mirar el reloj.
Meditar 5 minutos antes de acostarme para calmar la mente.

pillars.title: Salud Mental y Emocional
subGoals: Practicar mindfulness o meditación diariamente durante 10 minutos.
Dedicar tiempo a actividades placenteras y hobbies cada semana.
Practicar la gratitud, anotando 3 cosas por las que estoy agradecido al día.
Establecer límites claros en mis relaciones personales y profesionales.
Aprender a decir 'no' cuando sea necesario para proteger mi energía.
Buscar apoyo social y hablar abiertamente sobre mis sentimientos.
Identificar y gestionar mis factores de estrés.
Pasar tiempo en la naturaleza al menos una vez por semana.

pillars.title: Prevención y Cuidado Médico
subGoals: Realizar un chequeo médico anual completo.
Mantener al día mis vacunas.
Realizar autoexámenes regulares (ej: piel, mamas).
Consultar al dentista para revisiones y limpiezas semestrales.
Informarme sobre signos tempranos de posibles enfermedades.
Evitar hábitos perjudiciales como fumar y el consumo excesivo de alcohol.
Controlar mi presión arterial y niveles de colesterol regularmente.
Tener un botiquín de primeros auxilios bien surtido y familiarizarme con su uso.

pillars.title: Gestión del Estrés
subGoals: Identificar las principales fuentes de estrés en mi vida.
Implementar técnicas de relajación como respiración profunda o visualización.
Establecer tiempo libre para desconectar del trabajo y las responsabilidades.
Priorizar tareas para evitar sentirme abrumado.
Practicar la auto-compasión y ser amable conmigo mismo.
Participar en actividades que me recarguen energía (ej: hobbies, paseos).
Buscar ayuda profesional si el estrés se vuelve inmanejable.
Practicar afirmaciones positivas diarias para contrarrestar pensamientos negativos.

pillars.title: Hidratación y Bienestar Hídrico
subGoals: Llevar siempre conmigo una botella de agua reutilizable.
Establecer recordatorios para beber agua a lo largo del día.
Incorporar alimentos ricos en agua (sandía, pepino, naranjas).
Reducir el consumo de bebidas azucaradas y con cafeína.
Preparar infusiones de hierbas relajantes y sin cafeína.
Observar el color de mi orina como indicador de hidratación (debe ser pálido).
Aumentar la ingesta de agua antes, durante y después del ejercicio.
Usar un humidificador si el ambiente es seco para ayudar a la hidratación de las mucosas.

pillars.title: Conciencia Corporal y Autocuidado
subGoals: Prestar atención a las señales de mi cuerpo (hambre, sed, fatiga, dolor).
Realizar masajes o baños relajantes una vez a la semana.
Dedicar tiempo a la higiene personal de forma consciente y placentera.
Evitar la multitarea y centrarme en una actividad a la vez.
Practicar el autocuidado sin culpa, reconociendo que es una necesidad.
Celebrar mis pequeños logros y progresos en el camino hacia una mejor salud.
Aprender técnicas de relajación muscular progresiva.
Establecer un horario semanal que incluya tiempo para mí y mis necesidades.

classification.summary: Dormir a las 2 am impacta directamente el pilar de Sueño Reparador, ya que indica un horario de sueño poco saludable. También puede afectar la Hidratación y Bienestar Hídrico si se consumieron líquidos antes de acostarse y la Conciencia Corporal y Autocuidado al no priorizar el descanso.

Drinking 20 beers has a negative impact on Nutrition Balanceada, Actividad Física Regular, and Hidratación y Bienestar Hídrico due to the high caloric content and dehydration. It might temporarily affect Salud Mental y Emocional through intoxication but doesn't contribute to long-term well-being in this pillar. It does not contribute to other pillars.
